userreviews.userReview: Check out more manga and graphic novel reviews @ Perspective of a Writer...As the second volume of a manga my rating is affected by the previous volumes! See my review of volume one...In the sequel series to Tokyo Ghoul, Haise Sasaki has been tasked with teaching his special squad of half-ghouls how to be outstanding Investigators, but this is complicated by the troublesome personalities of his subordinates and his own uncertain grasp of his Ghoul powers. Will he and the members of his squad become heroes or monsters, taken out by the other squads in the Commission of Counter Ghoul...?!I've got to start with the art because yeah, I picked it up because of the gorgeous watercolor art and the strikingly realistic black and white drawings. It's just as gorgeous this volume as the previous one. There was some great techniques to show the auras of a couple of the characters as well as some incredible frames that start the battles at the end. The character designs are such that even if I don't know some of the secondary characters' names I can still keep them separate visually, quite an accomplishment if you are going to have so many characters!The plot of this volume is to setup the investigation needed for the huge battles in volume 3! I'm so glad I was able to review volumes 2 and 3 together because storywise they are heavily linked (I suggest picking them up together!) As such they act as a great contrast to each other. We meet a fourth Quinx who hadn't appeared in volume 1 and a crazy great special investigator Juzo, who is friends with Haise! And a bunch of antagonists are inserted in compelling ways... I wasn't always able to follow what was going on but I was engaged in each of the side characters.You just can't help but love how rich with character and plot this story is... A LOT is crammed into each volume... its well worth the price from that standpoint alone! But the tension is ratcheted up in this volume and I was particularly worried for Toru... But because there are sooooo many character (something I LOVE) the tension doesn't stay high. You are too busy switching from person to person and trying to figure out what those frames mean. I don't mind this but I'm also not flying through the volume... its more a series you want to buy and savor.I've really been sucked into the world and the different motivations of all the characters. They range from pure hearted Haise, to selfish Urie, to the ghouls who sometimes don't feel as evil as they should... While I am confused at times I wouldn't want the story to be simpler or less involved. That's part of the story's charm and why you feel compelled to keep reading.⋆⭐⭐⭐⭐ Authenticity⋆⭐⭐⭐⭐ Tension⋆⭐⭐⭐⭐ Plot⭐⭐⭐⭐⭐ ArtBOTTOM LINE: BATTLES, here I come!!!Thanks to Diamond Bookshelf and the publisher for providing me with a copy in exchange for an honest review. This has not influenced my opinion.______________________You can find this review and many others on my book blog @ Perspective of a Writer. See my manga and graphic novel reviews in a special feature called Saturday Morning Cartoons...
surrender that body already, I think I want him to get out of that body already and bring back the white, beautiful Kaneki to me  Couldn't agree more and couldn't have said it better.
Loved it! I really like where the story is going.

این جلد سورپرایز های بیشتری نسبت به جلد قبل داشت! اونقدر همه چیز جدیده که واقعا نمی دونم چه احساسی نسبت به وقایع داشته باشم... ولی خوندنش خیلی لذت بخش بود! مشتاقم هرچه زودتر ببینم چه اتفاقی بین شخصیت ها میافته.+ 4.5 ستاره؛ رند به چهار. می خوام 5 ستاره رو نگه دارم واسه بهترین جلدای مجموعه؛ یعنی امیدوارم از این بهتر هم باشه.
JUUZOU!!!!!! 👏🏼👏🏼👏🏼YES, BABY!!!👏🏼💪🏼YOU GO!📢📢🔪🔪🔪 P.S. that last panel GODGH the hell did they do to that sweet innocent boy? (I mean, I can guess but) 😩

Ugh, I love where this is going. If you're getting a little stuck in the first prequel series (not JACK, but just plain ol' Tokyo Ghoul), hang in there until the end. It makes all the difference for re:. Not going to spoil anything but let's just say that we get to see a deeper look at Haise's personality and motivations, and who he REALLY is (though for those who read the original TG, I don't think it'll be a surprise). LOVED this, can't wait for more.

It is really hard to care for the new people at the CCG seeing our friends on the other sideTouka <3 Hinami time has really passed :(Arima / Sasaki relation is really something, I really want to know what he exactly did after their fight ...new Juuzou is great!!!

Aquí es donde los personajes que amabas en TK regresan para apuñalarte por la espalda. Haise Sasaki está caminando sobre una delgada cuerda respecto a su identidad: es una bomba que va a explotar. Por otro lado, la intriga está al máximo, los altos mandos del CCG parece que ocultan algo... *Having feelings for all of the Quinx Squad.*Creo que no había mencionado antes la diversidad sexual de los personajes, pero creo que es algo que vale la pena mencionar. En Tokyo Ghoul ya había al menos un par de personajes homosexuales (Nico y Tsukiyama –quien siempre ha estado tras los huesitos de Kaneki, en más de un sentido– y Juuzou –cuya situación es "especial") y ahora un miembro de los Q's es transgénero. Bonus: a lo largo del arco de la subasta, varios personajes masculinos se visten de mujeres.
poor Takizawa.....

Non pensavo che ci sarebbe stata cosí tanta azione già dai primi volumi! È successo di tutto in questo volume! Torniamo infatti alle aste clandestine che Madame organizza per i ghoul. Finalmente Juuzo potrà riprendersi la sua rivincita! Tooru è in una brutta situazione, contesa tra Kanae (non vedo l'ora di rivedere Shuu) e Torso! E poi ci sono Hinami e Ayato!! Omioddio si! Cioè non capisco perchè sono insieme e Hinami non stia con Touka, ma cavolo ho l'hype a 1000! Spero l'intento sia recuperare Kaneki! E alla fine del volume...boom, scopriamo che Takizawa è ancora vivo, ed è diventato il ghoul Owl!! (si però con sta cosa di chiamarli tutti Owl, non è un po' un casino?). Beh insomma, non vedo l'ora di proseguire

Sui sensei is a fan of character building. He likes us to know the inner workings of not only the main characters but also the side characters. It's great! But after a while, I realised that most of them are really similar. Yes, some characters suffered more than the other but that doesn't mean their pain are inconsequential.I wish the plot would move quicker. This 360° view of the story is a bit of a hassle. Like Haise, the only thing I'm focusing on is will Haise still be Haise once he got Kaneki's memory back?

I'm very passionate about this series and I might not be very objective, but I liked this volume a lot! Great plot development and pacing, the art is amazing as well! The story is picking up and I look forward to reading vol. 3!The characters are so great, I always praised Tokyo Ghoul for complexity of the characters and I'm glad Tokyo Ghoul:re is like that too.

OTP is looking good here; they call each other on first name basis, and it's been implied they have worked together many times.pesan moralnya adalah bahwa crack ship pun punya kesempatan untuk berlayar.

That’s so cute.Chie Hori was in the same class as Shu?Only the best manga have scenes where the characters are disguised as the opposite sex. Especially male characters. Also I’d be lying if I said Haise wasn’t super attractive.I adore Turo.Oh my god, Nico….Oh Shinohara….UTA!The amount of people who get stabbed in the chest, I’m really not worried about Turo.HOLY FUCK SEIDOU WHAT DID THEY DO TO YOU?? OH MY GOD YOU POOR BABY!!
SUZUYAAAAAAAAAAAAAAAAAAAAAAAAAAAAAAAAA!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!
I miss the old crazy Kaneki :(

Juuzo
Touka ile karşılaştılar sonunda. O ne güzel çizimdi benim kalbim pırpır etti resmen. Çok seviyorum bu mangayı

Haise Sasaki takes his team of CCG quinx (ghoul/human hybrids) on a hunt for dangerous ghoul predators, involving them in a world of danger, intrigue, and cross-dressing. It ends with a ghoul auction in which one of that team finds himself in great peril and we meet one of Tsukiyama’s entourage who is determined that his Gourmet shall carry on, even if he no longer has the will to. We meet a score a new characters with sinister motivations, plus some old ones who’ve reinvented themselves, or are struggling to carry on in various dramatic way. The artwork in this is gorgeous. I was stunned by how beautiful both Sasaki and Touka were. I’m not sure what I think of Mutsuki and Urie yet. Shurazu is developing nicely as is Suzuya. I marvel at how much the latter has calmed down and matured in this new series. Kinue and Chie Horie are fascinating new additions to the cast. Ayato, Hinami, Orochi, and Donato intrigued me a great deal in the mysteries they presented and the changes they’d gone through. Additional matters of interest was Sasaki’s team cross-dressing and the various reactions to it. I was a little sorry Sasaki didn’t keep up his feminine guise. I would have loved to see Tsukiyama’s reaction to it, especially if our Gourmet had shown up and danced with our former prey at the club, ahem. I get the feeling we’re building up to a dramatic revelation regarding Tsukiyama, considering the new characters we’re meeting who are close to him and their concern regarding his welfare. I’m hoping Sanae Yonebayashi will get a little more development as well. I’m getting this feeling of untapped potential behind her lazy exterior, which reminds me of Shikamaru in the ‘Naruto’ manga. We’ll see if I’m right about this. The whole battle at the Auction was almost a return to the Gourmet plotline, only with higher stakes. A pity Tsukiyama and Urie didn’t make it to the action, but I’m hoping for something special we’re building up to with them. For overall story, dramatic tension, character development, and stunning artwork, this gets four stars.

At the Re coffee shop, Sasaki drank the coffee & actually cried but didn’t know why :O - Sasaki’s squad meets with Juuzou’s squad to work on the Nutcracker Ghoul case (a female ghoul who crushes and slurps men’s testicles wtf) - Juuzou’s hair is black now how bizarreeeeee And the great Tsukiyama Shuu is in a fit of depression over Kaneki’s loss - his great meal, RUINED.Sasaki also goes to visit Amon’s adoptive ghoul father in prison, whose interested in Sasaki’s own fucked up memories. To go after the testicle-eating Nutcracker, the 3 guys in Sasaki’s squad, himself included, will have to be disguised as girls HAHA- they go to a club the Nutcracker frequents & the Nutcracker invites one of Sasaki’s squad members to an auction run by Big Madam - disguised as girls, they’ll go to the auction along with Juuzou who wants to meet Big MADAM OMG - Ayato gets a msg from Eto from Tatara; to be a bodyguard at the next auction - so MAYBE KANEKI AND AYATO WILL MEET?!?!Urie (part of Sasaki’s squad) got an operation done to enhance his ghoul powers but he senses no changes yet. It’s time for the auction & Mutsuki (Sasaki’s squad member) & Juuzou go in as humans - and I;M PRETTY SURE A MASKED UTA IS ONE OF THE AUCTIONEERS!! OR MAYBE NOT? BUT Mutsuki is sold for 200 million and when it’s Juuzou’s turn, he gets out the knives and starts killing ghouls & the CCG’s extermination operation begins - but they run into the Aogiri too - Mutsuki’s cornered by Kanae (Shuu’s servant) who wants her for Shuu to get him out of his Kaneki-pining & depression.

Tssss... Por azares del destino Sasaki Haise y su equipo de quinx llegan a un cafecito que resulta que es atendido por nada mas y nada menos que Yomo & Touka, quienes se sorprenden muchísimo de ver a Sasaki/Kaneki pero no dicen nada porque obviamente no son reconocidos por este...:( No recuerdo que mas pasa... Están buscando a un Ghoul asesino que se lleva los Torsos de las mujeres que asesina... y Sasaki, Akira & los Quinx se dan a la tarea de buscarlo antes que los demás...No hay crazy Kaneki en este volumen... Extraño a Kaneki HAHA

The strength of TG is the character growths--Kaneki has the most violent and extreme changes, not always for the better, but ALL characters, even the side ones that don't seem very important, tend to go through some change based on the events and general violence in these books. Also pretty impressive that as violence in these books, as frequent and gruesome as it is, never gets too desensitized by the author--a difficult trick, and well done.

Wow, this was amazing. It was so nice to see characters such as Suzuya and Touka again. While I am loving meeting the new characters and they are slowly capturing my heart, the original series had so many characters that I fell in love with and they are once again tugging at the few heartstrings I have left.Looking forward to the third volume where they will probably tear them to shreads...

Aquí les asignan encontrar a la cascanueces.Reaparece el chico de los cuchillos y las costuras de el manga anterior. Cosa chistosa, ¿que cambio de cabello con Kaneki?Atacan una subasta.Aquí es un tanto confuso al parecer hay dos Ghouls llamados Madame.Oh , acaso van a matar al chico que fue carnada.
It's interesting and horrible to see some of the foreshadowing on a second read, but also, I understand a character a lot better now.4.5☆

description: 「僕は、僕が生きてきた20年間を知りません」　『半喰種』として任務に当たる指導者・佐々木琲世に対し、瓜江、不知、六月、米林ら「クインクス」のメンバーは、それぞれに複雑な思いを抱く。一層の戦力を拡大している喰種集団「アオギリの樹」の動向を探りつつ、次なる標的「ナッツクラッカー」の捜査へ。ふと引き寄せられた喫茶店で、ハイセは“懐かしい香り”と出会う。そこに、自身を紐解く大きな“鍵”が──？
title:
東京喰種トーキョーグール:re 2 [Tokyo Guru:re 2]
      
          (Tokyo Ghoul:re #2)
